title: (x) Print Magazine nameplate - custom version of Gotham {Héctor}
content:
does anyone happen to know what the typeface for Print's masthead?? i'm a student trying to enter into a competition they're holding, and i have no idea what their masthead's face is. thanx for any and all suggestions.

L
author: ls3designs

comments.content:
I think it's a custom version of HTF [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/www.typography.com)

Héctor

I thought it was Bryant by Process Type Foundry.

[http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150423162810/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant/index.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant/index.html")

Joseph Szala  
Vigor Graphic Design, LLC.  
 [www.vigorgraphics.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20150423162810/http:/www.vigorgraphics.net/ "www.vigorgraphics.net")
Print magazine does use a custom version of Gotham from Hoefler&Frere-Jones ... a cuddly version of NYC.

Wohoo!! is this my fifth or sixth type ID?

Héctor
Sorry, Héctor, I'm not exactly keeping track. ;^) Let me try something...
